Package via.sep3.group11.tier2.businessLogic

Class HostLogic

java.lang.Object
via.sep3.group11.tier2.businessLogic.HostLogic
All Implemented Interfaces:
HostInterface
@Service public class HostLogic extends Object implements HostInterface
Class implementing HostInterface. Class is implemented with @Service-annotation to mark it as a Spring-component.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • HostLogic

      public HostLogic(HostCommunicationInterface hostDAO, HousingCommunicationInterface housingDAO, AgreementCommunicationInterface agreementCommunicationInterface, org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder)
      All-argument constructor used to inject the two DAO's needed for communicating with the data-tier.
      Parameters:
      hostDAO - : Data Access Object used for accessing Host-information in the data-tier.
      housingDAO - : Data Access Object used for accessing Housing-information in the data-tier.
      agreementCommunicationInterface - Data Access Object used for accessing Agreement-information in the data-tier.

  • Method Details

    • getHostByHousingId

      public HostDTO getHostByHousingId(long housingId)
      Implementation of method used to find a host by housing id as the method implies. In the method, the housing referenced in the methods argument is placed in a new object and is checked if it is empty. If empty a HostDTO is returned that only contain the error message otherwise we return HostDTO that fulfils the initial argument with the error message set to empty.
      Specified by:
      getHostByHousingId in interface HostInterface
      Parameters:
      housingId - housing ID that is used as a reference to find a host.
      Returns:
      HostDTO

    • deleteAccount

      public HostDTO deleteAccount(String email)
      Implementation of the method used to delete a host account In the method, new host object is created where the referenced object from the given email address is put in. In order to check if the account exists, the object is checked if empty and if yes a DTO with only an error is sent. If the host object is not empty, there may be agreements and housing associated with the host, therefore a check is done through all agreements and if there are any accepted (active), a new DTO is sent with an error message otherwise we remove any pending agreements and housing and finally the host.
      Specified by:
      deleteAccount in interface HostInterface
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the host that is required to be deleted.
      Returns:
      HostDTO

    • updateInformation

      public HostDTO updateInformation(HostUpdateDTO dto)
      Implementation of the method used to update host personal information. In the method, new host object is created where the referenced object from the given email address is put in. In order to check if the account exists, the object is checked if empty and if yes a DTO with only an error is sent. If the dto is not empty there is multiple checks made in order to make sure that needed personal data is not empty and if so an error message is sent otherwise new data is set.
      Specified by:
      updateInformation in interface HostInterface
      Parameters:
      dto - a DTO object that contains new updated data
      Returns:
      HostDTO

    • getHostById

      public HostDTO getHostById(String email)
      Implementation of method used to find a host by hosts email as the method implies. In the method, the host with referenced email in the methods argument is placed in a new object and is checked if it is empty. If empty a HostDTO is returned that only contain the error message otherwise we return HostDTO that fulfils the initial argument with the error message set to empty.
      Specified by:
      getHostById in interface HostInterface
      Parameters:
      email - hosts email that is used as a reference to find a host.
      Returns:
      HostDTO
